summary: This document is an email chain from March 2020 discussing investigative leads related to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell's connections to the Interlochen Center for the Arts. It references financial records, potential witnesses, and the history of Epstein's donations and use of a scholarship lodge at Interlochen.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Central subject of the investigation; discussed in relation to his financial donations to Interlochen, the 'Epstein Lodge,' and his association with a potential witness.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned as being with Epstein when they met a potential witness at Interlochen and as a recipient of correspondence from Interlochen.

persons.name: The Interlochen Contact
persons.context: An unnamed contact at Interlochen Center for the Arts from whom investigators seek to confirm records of tuition payments made by Epstein or his entities for students.

persons.name: The Podcast Interviewee
persons.context: An unnamed woman interviewed on a podcast who described meeting Maxwell and Epstein at Interlochen and being told Epstein sponsored her because he 'liked her beautiful blue eyes.' Investigators consider reaching out to her for an interview.

connections.description: Described as being together at Interlochen when they approached a potential witness, and both are recipients of correspondence from Interlochen regarding donations and the lodge.
Epstein is identified as the sponsor of the interviewee's tuition at Interlochen, with Maxwell stating the sponsorship was due to Epstein liking her 'blue eyes.'
Maxwell was present with Epstein when they met the interviewee at Interlochen and was the one who communicated the reason for Epstein's sponsorship to her.

events.title: Wexner Foundation Donation for Epstein Lodge
events.description: The Wexner Foundation donated $185,000 for the 'Epstein Lodge' at Interlochen.

events.title: Epstein's Flight to Interlochen
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein flew to Interlochen in August 1994, which investigators believe is around the time he and Ghislaine Maxwell met a potential witness there.

events.title: Interlochen Letter to Epstein
events.description: Interlochen sent a letter to Jeffrey Epstein thanking him for a $200,000 gift for a new scholarship lodge, noting he could use the cabin for two weeks each summer.

events.title: Interlochen Letter to Maxwell
events.description: Interlochen sent a letter to Ghislaine Maxwell enclosing an item (an envelope) found in the lodge during cleaning.

events.title: Investigation into Interlochen Records
events.description: Investigators in March 2020 are discussing strategies to obtain complete tuition payment records from Interlochen and to interview a potential witness identified from a podcast.

keyFacts: Investigators were seeking in March 2020 to confirm whether Interlochen had records of any tuition payments made by Jeffrey Epstein or his entities for students, suspecting more students were sponsored than records showed.
A 1994 letter from Interlochen to Epstein thanked him for a $200,000 gift for a 'new scholarship lodge' (the Epstein Lodge) and granted him use of the cabin for two weeks each summer.
The Wexner Foundation donated $185,000 for the Epstein Lodge in July 1994, weeks before Epstein flew to Interlochen in August 1994.
A potential witness, interviewed on a podcast, described meeting Maxwell and Epstein at Interlochen and being told her tuition was sponsored because Epstein 'liked her beautiful blue eyes.'
Investigators considered reaching out to both the Interlochen contact and the podcast interviewee for formal interviews as part of their investigation.
